learning_outcomes.description: Describe the major animal phyla and their evolutionary relationships
Apply the basic animal plans to unfamiliar animals and understand how they are formed
Evaluate the different ways different groups of animals move, acquire food, respire, maintain fluid balance and reproduce based upon their anatomical structure and function.
Analyse the diversity of animal life-history and reproductive strategies based on structure, function and habitat of animals.
Identify an animal to phylum and order and know how to access information to identify animals to lower taxonomic levels.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be assessed via a short quiz each fortnight. The quiz will cover content covered in the two weeks leading up to the quiz. 

The highest marks from 5 of the 6 quizzes will contribute towards your final grade.

Quizzes will primarily cover material learned in the in-person classes and preparation reading, but will also include some content from the online learning where it is directly relevant to practical class activities. Each quiz that contributes to your final grade is worth 10% of your final grade.

Quiz questions will be drawn from a pool of questions, such that each student will receive a different set of quiz questions.


Quizzes are a set duration (40 min) and will be due within 48h after completing the in-person class in weeks 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 and 13.

Quiz 1: Opens 1pm 12/08/25 and due 1pm 14/08/25 (Week 3)

Quiz 2: Opens 1pm 26/08/25 and due 1pm 28/08/25 (Week 5)

Quiz 3: Opens 1pm 09/09/25 and due 1pm 11/09/25 (Week 7)

Quiz 4: Opens 1pm 23/09/25 and due 2pm 27/10/25 (Week 13) (correction made)

Quiz 5: Opens 1pm 14/10/25 and due 1pm 16/10/25 (Week 11)

Quiz 6: Opens 1pm 28/10/25 and due 1pm 30/10/25 (Week 13)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quizzes will be available online via the Inspera assessment platform and submitted within Inspera platform.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Covers material covered in entire course.

assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
NOTE ON COURSE STRUCTURE

The course structure and content for BIOL2204 in 2025 is similar to recent years, but very different to years prior to 2022.

This course is a mix of online learning and in-person practical classes. Students are expected to complete approximately 3 hours online learning per week (plus personal study time) as well as the in-person class. The online learning modules are designed to make your learning more interactive and effective than a traditional lecture format. The in-person practical classes will be held for 2-3 hours per week on campus as per your timetable. Here you will do hands on activities and work alongside your tutors and lecturers in the laboratory or in workshop-style groups. Practical classes are great places to bring questions you have about the online learning. An online discussion board is also available for your support.

A not-to-be-missed class where you will learn about essential course information and get to meet and interact with course staff and other Zoology students. Our aim is to set you up for a strong start to the semester by tapping into your inner zoologist!
